00022 // Globals
00023 static t_class          *s_receive_class;                                       // Required: Global pointer the jcom.receive class
00024 static t_object         *s_receivemaster_object = NULL;         // An instance of the jcom.receivemaster class

00027 /************************************************************************************/
00028 
00029 void receive_initclass()
00030 {
00031         long attrflags = 0;
00032         t_class *c;
00033         t_object *attr;
00034         
00035         // Define our class
00036         c = class_new(  "jcom.receive", 
00037                                         (method)receive_new, 
00038                                         (method)receive_free, 
00039                                         sizeof(t_receive), 
00040                                         (method)0L, 
00041                                         A_GIMME, 
00042                                         0);
00043         class_obexoffset_set(c, calcoffset(t_receive, obex));
00044 
00045         // Make methods accessible for our class: 
00046         class_addmethod(c, (method)receive_dispatch,            "dispatch",                     A_CANT, 0);
00047         class_addmethod(c, (method)receive_setcallback,         "setcallback",          A_CANT, 0);
00048     class_addmethod(c, (method)receive_assist,                  "assist",                       A_CANT, 0);
00049     class_addmethod(c, (method)object_obex_dumpout,     "dumpout",                      A_CANT, 0);  
00050     class_addmethod(c, (method)object_obex_quickref,    "quickref",             A_CANT, 0);
00051         
00052         // ATTRIBUTE: name
00053         attr = attr_offset_new("name", _sym_symbol, attrflags,
00054                 (method)0, (method)receive_setname, calcoffset(t_receive, attr_name));
00055         class_addattr(c, attr);
00056         
00057         // Finalize our class
00058         class_register(CLASS_BOX, c);
00059         s_receive_class = c;
00060 }

00063 /************************************************************************************/
00064 // Object Life
00065 
00066 // Create
00067 void *receive_new(t_symbol *s, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00068 {
00069         long            attrstart = attr_args_offset(argc, argv);               // support normal arguments
00070         t_receive       *x = (t_receive *)object_alloc(s_receive_class);
00071 //      t_atom          a;
00072 
00073 //post("have x: %x", x);
00074         if(x){
00075                 object_obex_store((void *)x, _sym_dumpout, (object *)outlet_new(x, NULL));
00076                 x->outlet = outlet_new(x, NULL);
00077 
00078                 if(!s_receivemaster_object)
00079 //                      s_receivemaster_object = (t_object *)object_new(CLASS_NOBOX, gensym("jcom.receivemaster"));
00080                         s_receivemaster_object = (t_object *)object_new_typed(CLASS_NOBOX, gensym("jcom.receivemaster"), 0, NULL);
00081 //post("have master: %x", s_receivemaster_object);
00082                 x->callback = NULL;
00083                 x->attr_name = NULL;
00084 //              attr_args_process(x, argc, argv);                                       // handle attribute args                                
00085 
00086                 // If no name was specified as an attribute
00087                 if(x->attr_name == NULL){
00088                         if(attrstart > 0)
00089                                 x->attr_name = atom_getsym(argv);
00090                         else
00091                                 x->attr_name = gensym("jcom.receive no arg specified");
00092 //                      receive_bind(x);
00093                 }
00094         }
00095         return x;
00096 }

00099 // Destroy
00100 void receive_free(t_receive *x)
00101 {
00102         receive_remove(x);
00103 }

00105 /************************************************************************************/
00106 // Methods bound to input/inlets
00107 
00108 // Method for Assistance Messages
00109 void receive_assist(t_receive *x, void *b, long msg, long arg, char *dst)
00110 {
00111         if(msg==1)      // Inlets
00112                 strcpy(dst, "(signal) input to the module");
00113         else if(msg==2){ // Outlets
00114                 if(arg == 0) 
00115                         strcpy(dst, "output from remote");
00116                 else 
00117                         strcpy(dst, "dumpout");
00118         }
00119 }
00120 
00121 
00122 // ATTRIBUTE: name
00123 t_max_err receive_setname(t_receive *x, void *attr, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00124 {
00125         t_symbol *arg = atom_getsym(argv);
00126         
00127         if(x->attr_name != arg){
00128                 receive_remove(x);
00129                 x->attr_name = arg;
00130                 receive_bind(x);                
00131         }
00132         return MAX_ERR_NONE;
00133         #pragma unused(attr)
00134 }

00141 //              object_method(s_receivemaster_object, ps_add, x->attr_name, x);
00142 }
00143 
00144 
00145 void receive_remove(t_receive *x)
00146 {
00147         object_method(s_receivemaster_object, ps_remove, x->attr_name, x);
00148 }
00149 
00150 
00151 // This method is called by jcom.receivemaster
00152 // In reponse, we figure out if we should send the data to our outlet
00153 void receive_dispatch(t_receive *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00154 {
00155         if(x->callback)
00156                 x->callback(x->baton,  msg, argc, argv);        // call the registered callback on the object that we're instantiated inside of
00157         else
00158                 outlet_anything(x->outlet, msg, argc, argv);
00159 }
00160 
00161 
00162 //      When we are inside of another external, we need a way to transmit messages
00163 //      to it. This function sets up another callback, which can call a function 
00164 //      in that external to transmit the message.
00165 void receive_setcallback(t_receive *x, void *callback, void *arg)
00166 {
00167         x->callback = (t_receive_obex_callback)callback;
00168         x->baton = arg;
00169 }
